definition: to feel grateful to sb/to appreciate the kindness
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: How ungrateful then that, as the talks limp towards collapse, accusing fingers are being pointed at America.
sentences.chinese: 隨着對話走向破裂，大家非常不領情面得指責美國。

sentences.english: It's monstrous that he should be so ungrateful for all the help his friends have given him.
sentences.chinese: 太可怕了，他竟然對朋友們的幫助如此不領情。

sentences.english: After all I had done, she was still ungrateful.
sentences.chinese: 儘管我做了這一切，可她仍然不領情。

sentences.english: It was Johnny's turn to be patronizingly patient.
sentences.chinese: 輪到約翰尼要人領情地耐心了。

sentences.english: I'm afraid I stand off because she will not be grateful.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我不能同意，因爲她是不會領情的。

sentences.english: It is a mistake to lavish kindness ungrateful people.
sentences.chinese: 對於不領情的人來說浪費感情是一種錯誤。

sentences.english: I'm not ungrateful. But I would like to have a baby.
sentences.chinese: 我並非不領情，但是我真的想要一個孩子。

sentences.english: If invited to someone's house for dinner, don't be one of he ungrateful fed.
sentences.chinese: 如果應邀到某人家中赴宴，別吃了還不領情。

sentences.english: It’s the typical face work frequently adopted by Chinese government, yet the foreigners never showed their gratefulness.
sentences.chinese: 這是中國政府典型面子工程，可外國人仍不領情。

sentences.english: More than the water did not appreciate, contemplating the psychological pull head incense.
sentences.chinese: 餘得水並不領情，心理盤算着拔香頭。

definition: lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
